decks.notes: The deck revolves around using various control spells and abilities to disrupt the opponent's strategy and protect Glarb, Calamity's Augur. It includes a mix of removal spells, counterspells, card draw, and disruption tools to maintain control of the game. The deck aims to control the board state while gradually setting up win conditions through card advantage and efficient removal. Glarb functions as a source of card advantage and can help generate incremental value over time. The deck prioritizes disrupting the opponent's game plan, protecting Glarb, and ultimately winning through attrition and incremental advantage. It focuses on outmaneuvering the opponent and maintaining control of the game until a win condition presents itself.

This deck revolves around aggressive play with Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd as the commander. It focuses on controlling the board with cards like Containment Priest and Palace Jailer, while also applying pressure with creatures such as Blade Splicer and Skyclave Apparition. The deck utilizes a mix of removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Oust, along with disruptive creatures like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Drannith Magistrate to hinder opponents' game plans. Additionally, cards like Stoneforge Mystic and Umezawa's Jitte provide powerful equipment to enhance the deck's combat capabilities. Overall, the strategy of this deck is to maintain board presence, disrupt opponents, and apply pressure to secure victory in one-on-one matches.

This deck aims to control the game by utilizing Golos, Tireless Pilgrim's ability to search for powerful lands and spells from the top of the library. By ramping up quickly and efficiently, the deck aims to play big threats like Emrakul and Ulamog to overwhelm the opponent. It also features strong removal spells like Fatal Push and Swords to Plowshares to handle threats from the opponent. The deck includes a variety of utility lands and mana acceleration spells to ensure consistent mana production and card advantage. With a focus on powerful creatures and controlling the board, this deck aims to outvalue the opponent and dominate the game through superior card advantage and efficient threats.

The deck revolves around using a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to overwhelm the opponent and control the board. With a focus on sacrificing creatures for value and utilizing the graveyard, the deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain a consistent threat presence. Grist, Voracious Larva acts as both a powerful threat on the battlefield and a source of card advantage, allowing the player to maintain momentum throughout the game. By leveraging a mix of efficient removal, disruptive hand disruption, and resilient threats, the deck is designed to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent in a fast-paced 1 vs 1 format, ensuring a strong chance of victory through consistent aggression and resource management.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game using Aminatou, the Fateshifter as the commander. The deck includes a variety of control spells and removal cards to disrupt opponents' strategies and maintain board control. It also features cards that allow for graveyard interactions, such as Animate Dead and Unburial Rites, to help reanimate key creatures or disrupt opponents' graveyards. The deck includes a mix of counter spells, removal spells, and card advantage engines to out value opponents and stay ahead in the game. The goal is to manipulate the board state in your favor, disrupt opponents' plans, and ultimately win the game through card advantage and strategic play.

This deck is centered around utilizing Azusa, Lost but Seeking's ability to play additional lands each turn to ramp up mana quickly and overwhelm opponents with control spells. With a main deck consisting of 99 Wastes, this deck focuses on achieving a high amount of colorless mana sources to fuel powerful colorless spells and abilities. By efficiently ramping up mana production, the deck can cast devastating control spells to dominate the battlefield and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The goal of this deck is to outpace and outmaneuver opponents through efficient land play and resource management, ultimately leading to a decisive victory through overwhelming control.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a wide range of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful creatures like Niv-Mizzet Reborn. The key strategy is to disrupt opponents' plans while efficiently drawing cards and generating value from Niv-Mizzet's ability to potentially draw additional cards and find answers to any threats. The deck also includes versatile cards like Demonic Tutor and Tainted Pact to search for key pieces, along with a diverse land base to ensure consistent mana production. By maintaining control of the game and outvaluing opponents with a combination of removal, counterspells, and card advantage, the deck aims to secure victory by overwhelming opponents with powerful plays and resource management.
